thread.section_title: Latest Finance industry news - from just-style.com
thread.title: Puma sells Tretorn to Authentic Brands
thread.title_full: Puma sells Tretorn to Authentic Brands

title: Puma sells Tretorn to Authentic Brands
text:
Authentic Brands Group (ABG) has made its second acquisition this month with the purchase of Swedish luxury outdoor lifestyle brand Tretorn from Puma . 
Tretorn joins ABG's sports and lifestyle portfolio that includes the Spyder, Prince, and Tapout brands. 
The acquisition, for an undisclosed sum, follows the purchase of lingerie brand Frederick's Of Hollywood earlier this month. 
"With a heritage that spans more than 120 years Tretorn has an inherent and global association with tennis and luxury, " said Jamie Salter, CEO of ABG. "Tretorn holds a unique place in the minds and hearts of consumers worldwide - from performance, to athleisure to style, Tretorn has made a statement on and off tennis courts for decades." 
As part of the deal, Puma has sold the industrial property rights of the Tretorn Group, which include trademark rights, patents and designs, to ABG. Tretorn management will acquire the operating license from ABG and will continue to operateTretorn in the Scandinavian and European market. 
Puma said the sale is a result of its vision to become "the fastest sports brand in the world", focusing on its core categories within its core brands Puma and Cobra Golf. 
It acquired Helsingborg-based Tretorn in 2002. The company produces sports and leisure activity products such as footwear, rubber boots, riding boots and tennis balls. 
Authentic Brands said it will implement a licensing strategy with an emphasis on footwear, outerwear and tennis equipment for North America and Asia, which have been identified as key growth markets. The company is also in advanced discussions with a strategic licensing partner for North America to be announced in the near term.
